page.title: 07COMMUTING:AFFECTS ON PEOPLE.
page.content: In many cases people working in London offices leave between 6.30 and 7.00am. Most people travel by train after walking to the station. A large proportion of the local residential estates are filled with commuters many of whom moved out from London to Kent in the 1960's and 1970's when many of the newer houses were built. A journey can take upto 1.5 hours. People finish work between 4.30 and 7.00pm, with the majority of people returning after 6.00pm. Days so dominated by travel leave workers only a small amount of time in the evening because of their late arrival home. Many cannot see their children as much as they would like with spare time only at the weekends. Danger from stress illness is always a possibility. Rainham is on of the chief commuter stations in Kent and therefore affects local traffic./
